conclusion: The magnetic flux Φ through each turn of the coil varies sinusoidally with time t.
The graph shows the magnetic flux Φ as a function of time t.
The maximum magnetic flux Φ_m is 2.0 × 10^{-2} Wb.
The period T of the sinusoidal variation can be determined from the graph.
The period T is the time for one complete cycle, which is 6.28 × 10^{-2} s.
The angular frequency ω is given by ω = 2π/T.
Substituting T = 6.28 × 10^{-2} s, we get ω = 100 rad/s.
The maximum EMF (E_m) is given by the formula E_m = m ⋅ Φ_m ⋅ ω.
Substituting m = 100, Φ_m = 2.0 × 10^{-2} Wb, and ω = 100 rad/s, we get E_m = 200 V.
The maximum value of the electromotive force generated by the alternating current generator is 200 V.
